_note: This is SOURCE DATA for import, not a direct database dump. The sync script (lib/jobs/sync-agency-catalogs.server.ts) transforms this into agency_course_templates records. CMAS uses a star-based certification system: P1-P4 for divers, M1-M3 for instructors. Courses and requirements may vary slightly by national federation.

courses.name: One Star Diver
courses.description: The CMAS One Star Diver (P1) course is the entry-level certification in recreational scuba diving. This internationally recognized program provides comprehensive training enabling divers to undertake accompanied no-decompression dives to a maximum depth of 20 meters in open water with a diver of the same level or higher.
courses.medicalRequirements: CMAS Medical Statement required. Must demonstrate swimming competence and aquatic ability before instructor.

courses.name: Two Star Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) course builds on One Star skills with advanced diving techniques, rescue skills, and deeper diving capabilities. Certified divers can dive to a maximum depth of 30 meters with at least another Two Star Diver. With additional decompression training, divers may dive to 40 meters.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent, 20 logged dives after P1 certification, Current first aid and CPR certification (within 2 years)

courses.name: Three Star Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Three Star Diver (P3) course develops group leadership skills, advanced problem prevention and emergency response. This is the first step toward becoming a professional diver. Certified divers can lead groups and dive to 40 meters.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 65 logged dives (10 must be deeper than 30m), Deep Diving specialty, Rescue Diver specialty, Night Diving specialty
courses.medicalRequirements: CMAS Medical Statement required. Physician clearance recommended.
requiredItems: Dive slate and underwater writing tools

courses.name: Four Star Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Four Star Diver (P4) represents the highest recreational diver certification level. This advanced program develops expert-level skills in dive planning, leadership, and technical diving proficiency.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Three Star Diver (P3), 100+ logged dives, Multiple specialty certifications, Advanced rescue and leadership experience

courses.name: Rescue Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Rescue Diver Training Programme develops skills to prevent and manage dive emergencies. Students learn dive accident prevention, self-rescue, life-saving techniques, and emergency management through knowledge development, practical training, and realistic emergency scenarios.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent, 20 logged dives, First aid and CPR certification within 2 years
courses.medicalRequirements: CMAS Medical Statement required. Candidates must be reasonably fit with good swimming ability.

courses.name: Nitrox Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Nitrox Diver Training Programme introduces the theory and techniques of Enriched Air Nitrox diving. This program teaches safe use of Nitrox mixtures with up to 40% oxygen for no-decompression diving, extending bottom times and reducing nitrogen absorption.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent

courses.name: Advanced Nitrox Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Advanced Nitrox Training Programme expands knowledge beyond basic Nitrox, teaching use of Enriched Air Nitrox blends from EAN-22 to 100% oxygen. Divers learn to safely plan and execute dives utilizing various EAN mixtures to a maximum depth of 40 meters.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Nitrox Diver certification, CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 30 logged dives

courses.name: Gas Blender
courses.description: The CMAS Gas Blender Training Programme provides the knowledge and skills to competently and safely blend Nitrox gas mixtures. Students learn to calculate and create desired gas mixtures using specialized tables and computer software.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Nitrox Diver certification or equivalent

courses.name: Trimix Gas Blender
courses.description: The CMAS Trimix Gas Blender Training Programme provides knowledge and skills to competently blend Trimix gas mixtures containing oxygen, nitrogen, and helium. Essential for meeting the requirements of technical divers venturing to significant depths.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Gas Blender certification

courses.name: Deep Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Deep Diver Training Programme develops skills for safe deep diving beyond recreational limits. Students learn about deep diving physiology, nitrogen narcosis management, gas consumption planning, and emergency procedures for deep water situations.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 30 logged dives, Advanced Nitrox recommended
courses.medicalRequirements: CMAS Medical Statement required. Physician clearance recommended.
requiredItems: Dive computer with deep dive capability

courses.name: Wreck Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Wreck Training Programme enhances skills for recreational, non-penetration wreck diving. Topics covered include physical, physiological, and legal aspects of wreck diving, basic ship architecture and terminology, with focus on safe non-penetration wreck diving principles.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent, 20 logged dives

courses.name: Night Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Night Diving Specialty Training Programme provides knowledge and skills for safe night diving. Topics include nocturnal marine life behavior, dive site selection, potential hazards, and proper use of lighting equipment in low-light conditions.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent, 10 logged dives

courses.name: Underwater Navigation
courses.description: The CMAS Underwater Navigation Programme introduces divers to essential navigation techniques for both beginners and experienced divers. Students learn compass navigation, natural navigation, and distance estimation to navigate safely and confidently underwater.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent

courses.name: Search and Recovery
courses.description: The CMAS Search and Recovery programme trains divers in underwater search patterns, object recovery techniques, and lift bag usage. Skills include locating lost objects, proper search techniques, and safe recovery of items from the underwater environment.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent, 20 logged dives

courses.name: Drift Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Drift Diving Training Programme equips qualified divers with skills for safe drift diving in moving currents or tides. Students learn dive planning, site assessment, buoyancy control, navigation, and communication while being carried by currents.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent

courses.name: Ice Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Ice Diver certification programme provides knowledge and skills for safe diving under ice. Students learn about ice diving challenges, emergency procedures, tether systems, communication techniques, and teamwork essential for overhead environment diving.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 30 logged dives, Dry Suit certification, Rescue Diver certification
requiredItems: Full face mask or dry suit hood

courses.name: Dry Suit Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Dry Suit Diving Training Programme expands diving possibilities for colder waters. Students learn about dry suit types, fitting, donning/doffing procedures, buoyancy control, and emergency procedures specific to dry suit diving.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent

courses.name: Altitude Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Altitude Diver Training Programme introduces divers to altitude diving. Students learn about effects of altitude on the body, changes in atmospheric pressure, adaptations to dive tables, gas consumption, and buoyancy control at altitude.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 20 logged dives

courses.name: Cave Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Cave Diver Training Programme equips divers with essential skills for safe cavern and overhead environment diving within limits of light penetration. This foundational cave course emphasizes safety, proper techniques, and risk management.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 50 logged dives, Nitrox certification recommended

courses.name: Underwater Photography
courses.description: The CMAS Underwater Photography programme combines technical photography skills with safe diving practices. Students learn camera operation, lighting techniques, composition, marine life photography approaches, and how to maintain buoyancy while photographing.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent

courses.name: Sidemount Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Sidemount Diver programme teaches the configuration and techniques for diving with cylinders mounted at the diver's sides. Students learn proper equipment configuration, buoyancy and trim, and gas management with sidemount systems.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 30 logged dives

courses.name: DPV (Scooter) Diver
courses.description: The CMAS DPV (Diver Propulsion Vehicle) programme teaches operation and handling of underwater scooters. Students learn equipment configuration, DPV operation, buddy procedures, emergency protocols, and technical maintenance.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 30 logged dives

courses.name: Ocean Explorer
courses.description: The CMAS Ocean Explorer programme provides comprehensive understanding of marine life and marine sciences. Students gain awareness of marine ecosystems, sustainable diving practices, and become ambassadors for ocean conservation.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent

courses.name: Freshwater Biology
courses.description: The CMAS Freshwater Biology Training Programme introduces divers to freshwater life and sciences. Students develop understanding and appreciation for the diversity and importance of freshwater habitats and ecosystems.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent

courses.name: Underwater Cultural Heritage
courses.description: The CMAS Underwater Cultural Heritage programme increases awareness of submerged historical sites. Students explore shipwrecks, ancient structures, and artifacts while learning ethical guidelines for interacting with underwater heritage sites.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 30 logged dives

courses.name: Scientific Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Scientific Diver (SD) professional training provides guidance on safe diving practice under varying experimental and environmental conditions. Based on UNESCO's Code of Practice for Scientific Diving.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 50 logged dives, First Aid certification

courses.name: Advanced Scientific Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Advanced Scientific Diver (ASD) programme builds on Scientific Diver certification with advanced research methodologies, specialized scientific techniques, and leadership in underwater research projects.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Scientific Diver certification, 100 logged dives, Active research involvement

courses.name: First Aid Diver
courses.description: The CMAS First Aid Diver programme provides essential life-saving skills including CPR, basic life support, and diving-specific emergency response. Covers scene assessment, airway management, bleeding control, and shock management.
courses.prerequisites: None

courses.name: Oxygen Provider
courses.description: The CMAS Oxygen Provider programme teaches recognition of diving injuries requiring emergency oxygen and proper administration techniques. Students learn about dive injuries, oxygen equipment types, and safety considerations.
courses.prerequisites: None (First Aid certification recommended)

courses.name: Normoxic Trimix Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Normoxic Trimix Diver Training Programme introduces theory and techniques of Normoxic Trimix diving. Students learn to safely conduct Trimix dives with mandatory decompression stops to a maximum depth of 60 meters, managing nitrogen narcosis effects.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Advanced Nitrox Diver, 100 logged dives (50 Nitrox dives), Deep Diver specialty
requiredItems: Dive computer capable of Trimix calculations

courses.name: Advanced Trimix Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Advanced Trimix Diver Training Programme enables exploration to 100 meters using helium content below 18% in bottom mix. Training covers extensive dive planning, risk assessment, equipment selection, accelerated decompression, and support team coordination.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Normoxic Trimix Diver, 150 logged dives (75 technical dives), 25 Trimix dives
courses.medicalRequirements: Physician-signed CMAS Medical Statement with hyperbaric fitness
requiredItems: Surface marker buoy and multiple reels

courses.name: Extended Range Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Extended Range Diver programme develops skills for decompression diving using Nitrox or oxygen to 55 meters. Students learn technical gear configuration, accelerated decompression techniques, and stage decompression procedures.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Advanced Nitrox Diver, 50 logged Nitrox dives

courses.name: Semi-Closed Rebreather Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Semi-Closed Rebreather (SCR) Diver Training Programme provides knowledge and skills for safe SCR diving. Students gain comprehensive understanding of operational principles, physiological considerations, and dive planning for SCR systems.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 50 logged dives, Nitrox certification

courses.name: Closed Circuit Rebreather Diver
courses.description: The CMAS Closed Circuit Rebreather (CCR) Training Programme develops essential skills for safe CCR diving regardless of depth, diluents, or environment. Comprehensive training for both experienced and new CCR divers.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Diver (P2) or equivalent, 75 logged dives, Advanced Nitrox certification
courses.medicalRequirements: Physician-signed CMAS Medical Statement required with hyperbaric fitness

courses.name: Divemaster
courses.description: The CMAS Divemaster programme elevates Three Star Divers to professional leadership level. Students develop expertise to lead certified divers on open water dives, provide excellent customer service, and assist with equipment and dive organization.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Three Star Diver (P3), 100 logged dives, Current First Aid and Oxygen Provider certifications
requiredItems: First aid and oxygen kit familiarity

courses.name: Assistant Instructor
courses.description: The CMAS Assistant Instructor programme trains candidates to assist and support diving instructors during courses. Students learn teaching methodology, course assistance, and take substantial internship as foundation for instructor development.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Divemaster or Three Star Diver (P3), 80 logged dives (30 sea dives), 25 dives as dive leader

courses.name: One Star Instructor
courses.description: The CMAS One Star Instructor (M1) programme develops qualified instructors who can assist M2 instructors with teaching courses. Training covers teaching methodology, dive theory, practical instruction techniques, and student management.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Three Star Diver (P3), 100 logged dives, Emergency First Response (EFR) certification, Assistant Instructor certification recommended

courses.name: Two Star Instructor
courses.description: The CMAS Two Star Instructor (M2) programme qualifies instructors to teach the One Star Diver (P1) course as lead instructor. Advanced teaching methods and comprehensive open water instruction skills are developed.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Instructor (M1), 150 logged dives, Teaching experience assisting P1 courses

courses.name: Three Star Instructor
courses.description: The CMAS Three Star Instructor (M3) is the highest instructor level, qualifying instructors to train other instructors and conduct advanced diving courses. Advanced instruction techniques and instructor trainer skills are mastered.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Instructor (M2), 200 logged dives, Extensive teaching experience

courses.name: Freediver One Star
courses.description: The CMAS One Star Freediver course is the entry-level freediving certification. Students learn breath-hold techniques, proper finning, equalization methods, and safety protocols. Training includes static apnea (1:30 min), dynamic apnea (25m), and depth diving (10m).
courses.prerequisites: Swimming competence
courses.medicalRequirements: CMAS Medical Statement for freediving required

courses.name: Freediver Two Star
courses.description: The CMAS Two Star Freediver course builds advanced breathing techniques, relaxation methods, and mental preparation. Training includes static apnea (2:30 min), dynamic apnea (50m), and depth diving (15m). Certified freedivers can dive independently to 25m.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Freediver (F1)
courses.medicalRequirements: CMAS Medical Statement for freediving required

courses.name: Freediver Three Star
courses.description: The CMAS Three Star Freediver course develops expert-level skills and instructor prerequisites. Training includes static apnea (3:00 min), dynamic apnea (75m), and depth diving (25m). Certified freedivers can dive independently to 40m.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Two Star Freediver (F2)

courses.name: Freediver Four Star
courses.description: The CMAS Four Star Freediver course is the pinnacle of freediving certification. Advanced training includes constant weight, free immersion, and variable weight diving to 40m maximum. This level prepares athletes for competition and professional instruction.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Three Star Freediver (F3)
courses.medicalRequirements: Physician-signed CMAS Medical Statement with cardiac evaluation

courses.name: Pool Freediver
courses.description: The CMAS Pool Freediver course focuses on pool-based breath-hold techniques and apnea training. Students develop skills in static and dynamic apnea without open water depth requirements.
courses.prerequisites: Swimming competence
courses.medicalRequirements: CMAS Medical Statement for freediving required

courses.name: Freediving Instructor Level 1
courses.description: The CMAS Freediving Instructor Level 1 programme qualifies experienced freedivers to teach beginner freedivers. Training covers teaching methodology, safety protocols, and student supervision for pool and open water instruction.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Three Star Freediver (F3) or Four Star Freediver (F4), Current First Aid and CPR certification

courses.name: Freediving Instructor Level 2
courses.description: The CMAS Freediving Instructor Level 2 programme develops advanced teaching skills and qualifies instructors to certify students at higher levels. Requires experience certifying at least 40 students.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Freediving Instructor Level 1, Active status, 40+ student certifications

courses.name: Freediving Instructor Level 3
courses.description: The CMAS Freediving Instructor Level 3 is the highest freediving instructor certification. Qualifies instructors to train other instructors and oversee freediving programs. Requires 100+ student certifications.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS Freediving Instructor Level 2, Active status, 100+ student certifications across all levels

courses.name: Team Leader
courses.description: The CMAS Team Leader specialty develops dive leadership and group management skills. This is one of three required specialties for progression from One Star to Two Star Diver certification.
courses.prerequisites: CMAS One Star Diver (P1) or equivalent, 15 logged dives
